items.text: To the chief Musician upon Aijeleth Shahar, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician upon Aijeleth Shahar, A Psalm of David.

items.text: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?
items.plainText: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

items.text: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
items.plainText: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

items.text: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.
items.plainText: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

items.text: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
items.plainText: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

items.text: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
items.plainText: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

items.text: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
items.plainText: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

items.text: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,
items.plainText: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

items.text: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.
items.plainText: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

items.text: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother's breasts.
items.plainText: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother's breasts.

items.text: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother's belly.
items.plainText: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother's belly.

items.text: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
items.plainText: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

items.text: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.
items.plainText: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

items.text: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
items.plainText: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

items.text: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
items.plainText: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

items.text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
items.plainText: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

items.text: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.
items.plainText: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

items.text: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.
items.plainText: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

items.text: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
items.plainText: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

items.text: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
items.plainText: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

items.text: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.
items.plainText: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

items.text: Save me from the lion's mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.
items.plainText: Save me from the lion's mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

items.text: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
items.plainText: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

items.text: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.
items.plainText: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

items.text: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.
items.plainText: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

items.text: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.
items.plainText: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

items.text: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.
items.plainText: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

items.text: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
items.plainText: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

items.text: For the kingdom is the LORD's: and he is the governor among the nations.
items.plainText: For the kingdom is the LORD's: and he is the governor among the nations.

items.text: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.
items.plainText: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

items.text: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
items.plainText: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

items.text: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
items.plainText: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
